title: 113_hr929
content: The "Patriot Corporations of America Act of 2013" provides a federal contracting preference for Patriot corporations defined in the Internal Revenue Code. These corporations will receive a tax reduction and preference in government procurement after December 31, 2013, unless it jeopardizes national security interests. The "Patriot Corporations of America Act of 2013" offers tax reduction for Patriot corporations certified by the Secretary as meeting specific requirements. The "Patriot Corporations of America Act of 2013" provides tax incentives for corporations meeting specific criteria, including producing 90% of goods and services in the US, limiting executive compensation, and conducting a significant portion of research and development domestically. The "Patriot Corporations of America Act of 2013" offers tax incentives to corporations meeting criteria like conducting research and development in the US, contributing to a pension fund, providing health insurance, and maintaining neutrality in employee organizing drives. The "Patriot Corporations of America Act of 2013" offers tax incentives to corporations meeting criteria such as providing full differential salary and insurance benefits for National Guard and Reserve employees called to active duty, complying with federal regulations related to environment, workplace safety, labor relations, and consumer protections, and not violating any other regulations specified by the Secretary. The Secretary will establish a certification process for Patriot corporations within 90 days of enactment. Certification applies to taxable years after December 31, 2013, with the option to certify for the preceding year. The Secretary will establish a certification process for Patriot corporations within 90 days of enactment, applicable to taxable years after December 31, 2013, if the corporation meets the requirements of paragraph (2)(B) of such section for such taxable year. SEC. 4. Tax avoidance foreign corporations subject to United States income tax. The amendment to section 7701(a)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code defines "domestic" for corporations and partnerships created or organized in the United States or under U.S. law, unless specified otherwise by the Secretary. Foreign corporations engaging in tax avoidance may be treated as domestic if determined by the Secretary. The amendment made by this section applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act, determining if a corporation was created as a foreign entity to avoid being treated as a domestic corporation under the Internal Revenue Code.
